TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS: Fine-loamy, carbonatic, mesic Aquic Paleorthids

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON:  Hardy - loam.
0 to 3 inches; gray (10YR 5/1 to 6/1), between dark-gray and dark grayish-brown (4/1.5) moist; loam; strongly calcareous; moderately to strongly thin platy material that breaks to medium and fine granules; slightly hard when dry, friable when moist; moderately permeable; high in water-holding capacity; and moderate in content of organic matter. (2 to 4 inches thick)
3 to 15 inches; gray (10YR 6/1) dark-gray (4/1) moist; silt loam or light-textured clay loam; strongly calcareous; moderately to strongly developed coarse to medium granular; hard when dry, friable when moist; moderately permeable and high in water-holding capacity. (5 to 14 inches thick)
15 to 35 inches; white (10YR 8/2) pale-brown (6/3 or 6/2.5) moist; loam; massive; breaks to subangular blocky fragments that are slightly hard when dry, friable when moist; this is moderately permeable and has a good water-holding capacity. (6 to 30 inches thick)
35 to 72 inches; white (10YR 8/2), very pale-brown (7/3) moist; hardpan, probably of loam texture; hardpan is very hard when dry, hard when moist; massive or slightly  laminated in places; slowly to very slowly permeable; in places the hardpan is not so thick but is underlaid by stratified materials ranging from fine sandy loam to sandy clay loam; massive material that contains many lime carbonate nodules.

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION:  About 2 miles southwest of Fillmore, Utah.

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content: RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS:  Moderate variations occur in thickness of the dark-colored surface horizons, and considerable variation occurs in depth to and thickness of the hardpan.

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content: GEOGRAPHIC SETTING:  Flat low lake terraces and valley floor; low hummocks and shallow drainageways in places; slopes are usually less than 2 percent.

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY:  Runoff slow to ponded; internal drainage moderate above the hardpan in well drained areas.  Slow to very slow through the hardpan.  Internal drainage is restricted in areas that have a high water table.

REGIONAL OFFICE.content: USE AND VEGETATION:  Grazing; with moderate to low carrying capacity and with moderate to good carrying capacity in the more moist, poorly drained areas.  Where these soils are cropped in the Provo-Goshen area, small grains, sugar beets, and truck crops are grown, and moderately good yields are obtained.  Saltgrasses including both Sporobolus airoides and Disticulus spicata, with some sedges and other meadow grasses in the more moist areas.

ORIGIN.content: DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT:  Bonneville Basin, Utah.
